Record date: 2079-01-05
INTERNAL MEDICINE ASSOCIATES
MESA VISTA HOSPITAL
Reason for visit
Followup of multiple medical problems.
Major Problems
Hand pain
The patient has been treated with Indocin and had resolution of his wrist swelling and pain, suggesting gout.
A: Stable.
P: Indocin PRN. We will check renal function today.
Claudication
The patient does not complain of pain today. He has vascular disease and Dr. Rico as well as our renal consultants were in contract about the optimal management and the worry of his renal artery stenosis. I have referred him back to Renal where he has not been seen in many months.
Coronary artery disease
There are no new symptoms. He had chest pain and an admission to Colonial Manor several months ago. There, an adenosine MIBI showed inferior scar and no reversible ischemia. Cardiac function was 67%. There was diffuse contraction thickening of the walls.
Diabetes mellitus
The patient remains on metformin, and hemoglobin A1c will be rechecked.
Hypertension
The patient remains on a complex regimen with the assistance of the Renal Service. He remains on hydralazine, atenolol, Cozaar, and Norvasc. His blood pressure has been stable by his report, and we get 150/80, repeated by me 150/70 today.
A: Metastable hypertension.
P: Follow up Renal Service and check BUN and creatinine today.
Renal failure
Has proteinuria and a creatinine approaching 3. I have asked him to reschedule a followup with the Renal Service.
Active Medications
aspirin 325 mg 1 tab po QD
atenolol 50 mg 1 tab po QD
clotrimazole (lotrimin) cream top bid to feet
Cozaar 25mg po qd
Glucophage 500 mg 1 tab po QD
hydralazine 10 mg PO TID
Indocin 50 mg po tid take with food
Lipitor 20 mg 1 tab po QD
Lotrisone cream PRN
Norvasc 10 mg 1 tab po QD
Review of systems
No chest pain, palpitations, shortness of breath, dyspnea on exertion, orthopnea, or leg swelling or pain.
Physical examination
Pulse 70
Blood pressure 150/80 , repeated by me 150/70
Weight 132 pounds
General appearance Well developed and well nourished in no apparent distress
Neck Carotids 2+. No bruit detected
Chest Clear to PandA without rale or dullness
Cor S1 and S2 without significant murmur
Abdomen Bowel sounds positive, cannot detect bruit today
Extrem Feet are well profused but only DP on the right is palpable
Assessment and plan
Renal failure, diabetes, coronary disease, and gout. We will check labs for stability. The patient had a report of apical thickening on a chest film at Colonial Manor and will repeat the chest x-ray today. The patient is to follow up with me in short order in the Renal Service.
Addendum
Chest x-ray was reviewed, and pleural thickening is stable since 2075. There is no CHF or parenchymal disease. There is vascular calcification of the aorta as well as coronary vessels.
Note transcribed by outside service
Transcription errors may be present.
